bibl.title: Letter from C.R. Darnall to Commanding General, Army Medical Center, November 26, 1935

div1.p: On behalf of the Walter Reed Memorial Association, Darnall requests that the Reed bust be kept in its present place at Walter Reed Hospital.

div1.head: Letter from C.R. Darnall to Commanding General, Army Medical Center, November 26, 1935
div1.opener:
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
1816 Lamont Street, N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
November 26, 1935.
Commanding General,
Army Medical Center.
(THRU The Surgeon General, U. S. Army)
div1.p:
I am directed by the Board of Managers of the Walter Reed
Memorial Association to request that the bust of Walter Reed,
at present in the lobby of the Administration Building of the
Walter Reed General Hospital, be kept there in the custody of
the commanding Officer of the hospital unless and until some
other disposition be made of it by the Board.

As a matter of record you are advised that the bust is
the work of Mr. Hans Schuler, of Baltimore.

It was made in 1905 and was paid for ($1,003.00) with
funds provided by the Walter Reed Memorial Association.
Please acknowledge receipt of this letter.
div1.closer:
/s/ C. R. Darnall
C. R. Darnall,
Brig. Gen., U. S. Army, Retd.,
Secretary of Board. ARMY MEDICAL CENTER WASHINGTON, D.C.
